author: maxvoltage.
content: Hi all.  A member of our crypto youtubers family, SavageMine, is in the hospital with Covid on a ventilator.  We are currently doing a Hash-a-thon from now through the end of the weekend for his family.  If you have the means and want to, please donate or hash to the following ETH address.  0x3783c3dA84a62e8847C7E656e05FE26A4b5E41a7  If you feel like watching, we are currently on a livestream.

author: sky.cactus
content: While I can appreciate your desire to help out a friend, this isn't the right discord server for soliciting donations or advertising a charity drive.  This is a research server and even the <#595721451651465227> channel should be focused on Ethereum research.

author: potuz
content:
Sorry guys for the really really off-topic question, but I want to confirm the url for a geth download.  I am getting this:
https://gethstore.blob.core.windows.net/builds/geth-linux-amd64-1.10.4-aa637fd3.tar.gz
Haven't downloaded geth binaries before, and I am quite surprised by the domain-name

author: potuz
content: <@!360491619402776577> Sorry to tag you for this, but you are the only one from geth and I am in a disjunctive as to building the toolchains or not

author: potuz
content: can you confirm the download server is on a "windows.net"  domain?

author: mvis.79
content: <@!755590043632140352>  For whatever it's worth, I've downloaded from there before and haven't had any problems.

author: potuz
content: Thanks, but I think I may be a little paranoid, if it was any other domainame I wouldn't worry much, the downloads page link is on the github repo, but the problem is that the pgp keys nor the md5 hashes are there. So I have to trust a site that it's pointing me to a "windows.net"  website. This is not good. I haven't spend anytime looking for the keys on the github repo cause I'm dealing with crying children... but I think I didn't miss anything

author: potuz
content: At this point I'm hoping that anyone involved in the release process of geth confirms me that the domain is correct. I'll wait a little bit otherwise I'll start downloading the toolchain to build it

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Yep can confirm, we're using microsoft azure to host our builds, you can look at our build pipeline here: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/2d4eff21ca798bcba833dae3ae719c1d6773ed3d/build/ci.go#L419

author: potuz
content: Oh thanks a lot, that does it for me.
